episodeTitle: Hurry up, Luffy! Shirahoshi's Life in Jeopardy!
episodeTitleJapanese: 急げルフィ！しらほし絶対絶命
description: Shirahoshi swims into the open ocean to lure Noah away from Fish-Man Island. Luffy attempts to reach the ship's chains underwater but faces deadly confrontation with Hody Jones, who uses his advantage as a fish-man in the sea to nearly drown Luffy before Fukaboshi intervenes.

events.title: Shirahoshi's Brave Decision
events.description: Princess Shirahoshi makes the courageous decision to swim into the open ocean to lure the massive ark Noah away from Fish-Man Island, putting her own life in jeopardy to save her people. She exits through the palace gateway, leaving the protective air bubble.
events.significance: This marks a pivotal character development moment for Shirahoshi, showing her transformation from a fearful princess to a brave protector of her kingdom. It demonstrates her growth and willingness to sacrifice herself for others.

quotes.text: I must save everyone on Fish-Man Island!
quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Shirahoshi's declaration as she swims toward Noah

events.title: Luffy Launches Toward Noah
events.description: Luffy, with Sanji's help, propels himself toward the massive ship Noah's chains to stop it from destroying Fish-Man Island. He creates an air bubble using bubble coral to breathe underwater.
events.significance: This begins Luffy's desperate underwater battle to save Fish-Man Island, showcasing his determination despite the severe disadvantage of being a Devil Fruit user in the ocean.

events.title: Kirisame Scythe Debut
events.description: Hody Jones reveals his deadly weapon Kirisame, a razor-sharp curved scythe blade that he attaches to his dorsal fin. He demonstrates its lethality by instantly decapitating an oarfish while swimming toward Luffy.
events.significance: The introduction of Kirisame showcases Hody's enhanced combat abilities underwater and establishes him as an even more dangerous opponent for Luffy in his weakened state.

quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody naming his scythe weapon as he unsheathes it

events.title: Vander Decken's Marriage Proposal Attack
events.description: Vander Decken IX offers Shirahoshi his hand in marriage once again. Upon her rejection, he releases another barrage of deadly projectiles at her, forcing the Neptune princes to defend their sister.
events.significance: This continues to show Vander Decken's obsessive and dangerous pursuit of Shirahoshi, while highlighting the protective bond between the Neptune siblings.

events.title: Underwater Confrontation - Luffy vs Hody
events.description: Hody Jones confronts Luffy in the open ocean, where Luffy realizes the extreme disadvantage he faces against a fish-man underwater. Hody's superior swimming speed and water-based combat abilities put Luffy at a severe disadvantage.
events.significance: This battle demonstrates the strategic importance of environment in combat and shows Luffy facing one of his most dangerous situations - fighting underwater as a Devil Fruit user against a fish-man enhanced by Energy Steroids.

events.title: Hody Bursts Luffy's Air Bubble
events.description: Hody Jones instantly bursts the protective air bubble Luffy created with his bubble coral, causing Luffy to begin drowning due to his Devil Fruit weakness. Hody prepares to deliver a fatal finishing blow to the helpless Luffy.
events.significance: This moment puts Luffy in mortal danger and showcases Hody's ruthlessness and tactical intelligence. It represents one of Luffy's most vulnerable moments in the series, facing death by drowning.

events.title: Fukaboshi Saves Luffy
events.description: Prince Fukaboshi arrives just in time to deflect Hody's finishing blow and provides Luffy with air, allowing him to breathe again and saving him from drowning. This intervention prevents Luffy's death.
events.significance: This establishes Fukaboshi as a crucial ally and demonstrates the growing alliance between the Straw Hats and the Neptune royal family. It shows that Luffy cannot defeat Hody alone underwater.

quotes.text: I won't let you harm Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: Fukaboshi defending Luffy from Hody's attack

events.title: Hody Stabs Vander Decken
events.description: In a shocking betrayal, Hody Jones reaches Noah's deck first and fatally stabs his ally Vander Decken IX with his trident. Hody's plan is to kill Decken so that his Mark-Mark Fruit powers will deactivate, causing Noah to drop directly onto Fish-Man Island and destroy it.
events.significance: This brutal betrayal reveals Hody's true ruthlessness and his willingness to sacrifice anyone, even allies, to achieve his goal of destroying Fish-Man Island and all its inhabitants. It demonstrates that Hody's hatred supersedes any loyalty or strategy.

quotes.text: I must save everyone on Fish-Man Island!
quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Shirahoshi's brave decision to lure Noah away

quotes.text: I won't let you harm Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: Saving Luffy from Hody's finishing blow

themes.description: Shirahoshi demonstrates tremendous growth by risking her life to save her people, while Luffy continues his pattern of selflessly fighting to protect others despite mortal danger.
themes.symbolism: The vast ocean represents both freedom and danger - Shirahoshi embraces it to save her home, while Luffy struggles against it due to his Devil Fruit weakness.

themes.description: Hody's betrayal of Vander Decken shows that his hatred and destructive goals supersede any alliance or loyalty.
themes.symbolism: The stabbing of Decken symbolizes how hatred destroys everything, even those who enable it.

themes.description: Fukaboshi's intervention to save Luffy cements the alliance between the Straw Hats and the Neptune royal family, showing how cooperation is necessary to overcome great threats.
themes.symbolism: The sharing of air underwater represents the literal life-giving nature of alliance and mutual support.

characterSpotlights.development: Shirahoshi overcomes her lifelong fear and confinement to actively save her kingdom, marking a major character transformation from passive victim to active hero.
keyActions: Swims into open ocean despite danger
Lures Noah away from Fish-Man Island
quotes: I must save everyone on Fish-Man Island!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces one of his most vulnerable moments, nearly drowning underwater while trying to protect Fish-Man Island, showcasing both his determination and limitations.
keyActions: Launches toward Noah with Sanji's help
Attempts to fight underwater with air bubble
Nearly drowns when Hody bursts his bubble

characterSpotlights.development: Hody's true nature is fully revealed through his betrayal of Vander Decken, showing he values his destructive goals above all alliances and lives.
keyActions: Attacks Luffy underwater using his fish-man advantages

characterSpotlights.development: Fukaboshi proves his worth as crown prince by saving Luffy's life and defending his sister, cementing his role as a crucial ally.
keyActions: Provides air to save Luffy from drowning
Protects Shirahoshi from Vander Decken's attacks
quotes: I won't let you harm Luffy!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the underwater battle sequences between Luffy and Hody for dramatic effect.
Additional animation showing the oarfish being decapitated by Kirisame was added to demonstrate the weapon's deadliness.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 638 of the manga, titled 'Runawayhoshi', a play on words combining 'runaway' with Shirahoshi's name.
The episode achieved an 8.1% TV rating in Japan, ranking #5 for its time slot.
Kirisame, Hody's scythe weapon introduced in this episode, will be broken by Luffy in Episode 562.
This episode originally aired on August 12, 2012 in Japan, but the Funimation simulcast was available on August 11, 2012, making it available internationally before the Japanese broadcast.
The English dub didn't air on Toonami until June 19, 2022, exactly 10 years after the original Japanese broadcast.
